channel.title: Compiling
channel.description: i used the private server tut from "The Soul" to change my environmental variables and it is still saying path not specified... :confused:

item.title: Compiling
item.dc:creator: @guitar_owner guitar owner
item.description:
@guitar_owner wrote:

ok when i downloaded that file there then it still didnt show up, so idk whats going on. if any could help me out with that i would highly appreciate it.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 01, 2009, 06:28:02 pm[/size][hr]anyone know??[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 02, 2009, 03:28:11 pm[/size][hr]bump

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling
item.dc:creator: @dogzound5 dogzound5@gmail.com
item.description:
@dogzound5 wrote:

yea that is what you need to do. When you are done you will see up in the path search bar. C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1. and then some numbers. That is the version number of your jdk and you must make that version that same version in your compiler.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling
item.dc:creator: @guitar_owner guitar owner
item.description:
@guitar_owner wrote:

i had jdk but im going to try to save it to a different path since it was saving to desktop, im going to save it to program files\java

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling
item.dc:creator: @dogzound5 dogzound5@gmail.com
item.description:
@dogzound5 wrote:

Hey, you need to download java jdk also.

http://java.com/en/download/index.jsp

Go to the link and download Java. When done, right-click your compiler and click edit. It will open up in Notepad. YOu need to check the path to your jdk folder. Make sure the version of your jdk matches that of the version in your compiler. You will see it in the path directory.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 01, 2009, 05:15:36 pm[/size][hr]Download to same Java folder as Jre.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling
item.dc:creator: @guitar_owner guitar owner
item.description:
@guitar_owner wrote:

uhmm i looked under that and i only got jre but when i download java it goes to desktop… do i need to download jdk to the same java folder?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

your variables are fine you just have the wrong path to your jdk in the compiler. check in c:\program files\java for your jdk and make sure it is the correct path in your compiler

Read full topic
